etymologies: late 15th century: from French tire ‘sequence, order’, from tirer ‘elongate, draw’

definitions: a row or level of a structure, typically one of a series of rows placed one above the other and successively receding or diminishing in size

examples.text: the room was full of three-tier metal bunks

shortDefinitions: each in series of rows or levels of structure placed one above other

definitions: one of a number of successively overlapping ruffles or flounces on a garment

examples.text: a full skirt gathered into three tiers

shortDefinitions: each of several successively overlapping ruffles or flounces on garment

definitions: a level or grade within the hierarchy of an organization or system

examples.text: companies have taken out a tier of management to save money

shortDefinitions: level or grade within hierarchy of organization or system
